Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>CciI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

">10</td><td style="border: 0px solid white; "></td></tr></tbody></table><p>Two (2) distinct types of restriction enzyme recognition sites, <i>MvnI</i> and <i>TaiI</i>, are labeled at the top of this DNA segment.</p><p><strong>Note:</strong> The dashes at both ends of the strand indicate that the next restriction site is far away and outside the visible region. Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>MvnI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Incorrect	E. 5 kb	Correct	F. 6 kb	Incorrect

">10</td><td style="border: 0px solid white; "></td></tr></tbody></table><p>Two (2) distinct types of restriction enzyme recognition sites, <i>AfeI</i> and <i>PacI</i>, are labeled at the top of this DNA segment.</p><p><strong>Note:</strong> The dashes at both ends of the strand indicate that the next restriction site is far away and outside the visible region. Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>AfeI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Incorrect	C. 3 kb	Correct	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect

">10</td><td style="border: 0px solid white; "></td></tr></tbody></table><p>Two (2) distinct types of restriction enzyme recognition sites, <i>MssI</i> and <i>DpnI</i>, are labeled at the top of this DNA segment.</p><p><strong>Note:</strong> The dashes at both ends of the strand indicate that the next restriction site is far away and outside the visible region. Because this segment is part of a much larger molecule, any uncut or very large fragments will not travel into the gel and will appear to be stuck in the well.</p><h6><strong>Determine the sizes of the DNA bands</strong> that would appear on an agarose gel after digestion with <i>MssI</i> only.</h6>	A. 1 kb	Incorrect	B. 2 kb	Correct	C. 3 kb	Incorrect	D. 4 kb	Correct	E. 5 kb	Incorrect
